verification_amount_inside.label: Verification amount inside range (default 1)
verification_amount_inside.info: The amount of verifications the app need to mark a beacon inside the range.

verification_amount_outside.label: Verification amount outside range (default 5)
verification_amount_outside.info: The amount of verifications the app need to mark a beacon outside the range.

interval.label: The interval between updates in seconds (default 10)
interval.info: The delay between reading sensor values in seconds.

timeout.label: Discovery timeout (default 10)
timeout.info: The amount of seconds that is given to discover the beacons.

repair.title: Replace the beacon
repair.prologue:
This maintenance procedure allows you replace a physical beacon without the need to remove and then read the device defined in Homey and therefore preserving all the flows that involve the device itself.
Some reasons for replacing the beacon:
repair.reason1: The beacon has been lost or damaged.
repair.reason2: The beacon has run out of battery and the battery is non-replaceable.
repair.reason3: You want to use a new, more powerful beacon.
repair.instructions: To replace the beacon please follow the instructions below.
repair.step1: Take note of the type () and details () of the beacon.
repair.step2: Configure the new beacon with the same values shown in previous step. This step is done outside of Homey with the tools provided by the beacon manufacturer.
repair.step3: Make sure the new beacon is within the range of Homey and tap the button below.
repair.epilogue: Tap the back arrow to cancel this procedure.
repair.not_discovered:
The new beacon has not been discovered.
Make sure that the beacon is within the range of Homey and that the new new beacon is configured with the correct values.
repair.retry_or_cancel: Tap OK to retry or CANCEL to cancel this procedure.
repair.refreshed: Device properties successfully refreshed with the values of the new beacon.
repair.nothing_to_be_refreshed: Procedure successfully completed. No properties to be refreshed (it seems that the beacon hasn't been replaced).
